Description: Pottery lagynos or jug; depressed globular body with slightly bulging sides on a ring base; narrow swelling neck with a rounded rim; single handle from shoulder to just below rim; buff clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: The numbers 186 and 30 pencilled on the vase may refer to the original find context, but this is uncertain. See D. Bailey, Op. Ath VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations at Kourion.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
